definitions: preliminary version of a written work before final completion
current of cool air moving through an enclosed space
compulsory recruitment of people for military service
written order for payment of money from a bank account
depth of water needed to float a ship or boat
examples: She reviewed the first draft of the manuscript before editing
The editor returned the draft with extensive comments and suggestions
A cold draft came through the window during the storm
She felt an uncomfortable draft from under the door
He received his draft notice during the Vietnam War
The military draft affected thousands of young men nationwide
The company sent a bank draft for the payment
International transactions often require a certified draft
The cargo ship requires a draft of thirty feet
Harbor pilots must know the draft of every vessel

definitions: person who has been conscripted into military service through a draft
examples: The draftees reported to the induction center for processing
Many draftees served with distinction despite being conscripted

definitions: process of creating detailed technical drawings and plans
act of writing or composing a preliminary version
process of selecting players for sports teams
examples: Computer-aided drafting has revolutionized architectural design
She studied drafting to become an architectural technician
The drafting of the new constitution took several months
Legal drafting requires precision and clarity
The team improved significantly after successful drafting
Professional sports drafting occurs annually

definitions: person who creates detailed technical drawings and plans professionally
person skilled in preparing legal or formal documents
examples: The draftsman prepared blueprints for the new building
Engineering firms employ skilled draftsmen for project design
The legal draftsman ensured the contract was properly worded
Parliamentary draftsmen write legislation for the government

definitions: resistance encountered when moving through air or water
something that is boring, tedious, or burdensome
clothing typically associated with the opposite gender worn as performance
inhalation of smoke from a cigarette or pipe
examples: The car's aerodynamic design reduces drag at high speeds
Swimmers shave their bodies to minimize drag in water
The long meeting was such a drag for everyone
Having to commute two hours daily is a real drag
The performers wore elaborate drag for the show
Drag queens entertained the audience with their performances
He took a long drag from his cigarette
She watched him take a final drag before extinguishing it

definitions: systematic search or investigation by police to catch criminals
large fishing net dragged along the bottom of water
examples: Police set up a dragnet to catch the escaped prisoners
The dragnet operation involved multiple law enforcement agencies
Commercial fishermen used dragnets to harvest bottom-dwelling fish
Environmental groups oppose dragnet fishing methods

definitions: large mythical creature typically depicted with wings, scales, and breathing fire
fierce or vigilant person, especially a strict woman
examples: The dragon guarded the treasure in the mountain cave
Medieval tales often featured knights battling fearsome dragons
Her mother-in-law was a real dragon about household rules
The office dragon made everyone's work life miserable

definitions: large predatory insect with elongated body and two pairs of transparent wings
examples: Dragonflies hovered over the pond catching mosquitoes
The iridescent dragonfly landed delicately on the lily pad

definitions: pipe or channel that carries away water or liquid waste
something that gradually depletes resources, energy, or strength
examples: The plumber unclogged the kitchen drain with special tools
Storm drains prevent flooding during heavy rainfall
The lengthy legal battle was a financial drain
Constant overtime became an emotional drain on employees

definitions: system of drains and pipes for removing excess water
liquid that has been drained or discharged from something
examples: The field's drainage system prevents waterlogging after rain
Poor drainage caused flooding in the basement
The nurse monitored the surgical drainage for signs of infection
Wound drainage decreased significantly after treatment

definitions: adult male duck of any species
examples: The drake displayed vibrant plumage during mating season
A mallard drake swam alongside several females

definitions: small amount of alcoholic drink, especially whisky
unit of weight equal to one sixteenth of an ounce
examples: He enjoyed a dram of fine Scottish whisky
The bartender poured a generous dram for the regular customer
The pharmacist measured ingredients using drams and grains
The old recipe called for two drams of spice

definitions: play or performance intended for theatrical presentation
exciting, emotional, or unexpected series of events or circumstances
academic study and practice of acting and theater
examples: The drama received critical acclaim on Broadway
Shakespeare's dramas continue to captivate modern audiences
The workplace drama unfolded when the scandal broke
Their relationship was filled with unnecessary drama
She studied drama at the prestigious performing arts school
Drama classes helped him overcome his shyness

definitions: adaptation of a literary work or real events into dramatic form for performance
examples: The BBC produced an excellent dramatisation of the novel
Historical dramatisations often take creative liberties with facts

definitions: person who writes plays for theatrical performance
examples: The dramatist won multiple awards for her groundbreaking work
Famous dramatists often draw from personal experiences

definitions: adaptation of a literary work or real events into dramatic form for performance
examples: The movie was a dramatization of actual court proceedings
Television dramatizations bring historical events to life

definitions: decorative cloth hung in loose folds, especially curtains
sterile cloth used to cover patients during medical procedures
examples: Heavy velvet drapes blocked the sunlight from the room
She selected new drapes to match the redecorated living room
The surgeon carefully positioned the surgical drape
Sterile drapes maintain a clean operative field

definitions: person who sells cloth and fabric materials in retail
examples: The draper displayed fine silks in the shop window
Victorian drapers were important members of the merchant class

definitions: decorative arrangement of cloth or clothing in loose folds
business or shop that sells fabric and cloth materials
examples: The artist captured the drapery beautifully in the painting
Classical sculptures often feature elaborate drapery
She worked at the local drapery for twenty years
The drapery supplied fabrics to interior designers

definitions: current of cool air in a room or confined space
single act of drinking or the amount drunk
depth of water needed for a ship to float
flat disc used as a playing piece in draughts
examples: A cold draught swept through the old cottage
She sealed the windows to prevent draughts
He took a long draught from the water bottle
The tavern served draughts of local ale
The harbor can accommodate ships with deep draught
Shallow draught vessels navigate the canal easily
She moved her draught diagonally across the board
The game of draughts requires strategic thinking

definitions: person who makes detailed technical drawings or plans
person who plays the game of draughts
examples: The architectural draughtsman prepared construction blueprints
Engineering draughtsmen use specialized software
The draughtsman won the championship tournament
Skilled draughtsmen study opening strategies

definitions: game or contest that ends with equal scores
selection of winners by random choice in lottery or raffle
person or thing that attracts public attention or customers
examples: The football match ended in a goalless draw
Both teams settled for a draw after extra time
The prize draw will take place next Friday
She won a car in the charity draw
The new exhibit was a major draw for tourists
Free samples were a draw for potential customers

definitions: feature that renders something less acceptable or desirable; a disadvantage or problem
examples: The main drawback of the plan was its high cost
Living downtown has drawbacks like noise and traffic

definitions: bridge that can be raised to allow ships to pass or prevent access
examples: The medieval castle's drawbridge protected against invaders
The drawbridge lifted to let the tall sailboat through

definitions: sliding box-shaped compartment in furniture for storage
person who writes a check or bill of exchange
examples: She organized her socks in the top drawer
The desk had three drawers for office supplies
The drawer's signature appeared on the bank check
Banks verify the drawer's account before processing

definitions: picture or diagram made with pencil, pen, or crayon
process of selecting winners randomly in a lottery or raffle
examples: The architect presented detailed drawings of the building
Children's drawings decorated the classroom walls
The drawing for the grand prize happens tonight
Ticket holders eagerly awaited the drawing results

definitions: great fear or apprehension about something that may happen
examples: She felt dread about the upcoming examination results
The thought of public speaking filled him with dread

definitions: series of thoughts, images, and sensations occurring during sleep
cherished aspiration, ambition, or ideal for the future
person or thing perceived as perfect or wonderful
examples: She had a vivid dream about flying over mountains
Nightmares are disturbing dreams that wake people up
His dream of becoming a doctor finally came true
They saved for years to achieve their dream of homeownership
The new car handles like a dream
Their beach vacation was an absolute dream

definitions: person who has unrealistic or impractical ideas or plans
person experiencing dreams during sleep
examples: He was a dreamer who believed anything was possible
Dreamers often struggle with practical daily tasks
Research shows all people are dreamers during REM sleep
Lucid dreamers can control their dream experiences

definitions: mental activity of experiencing dreams during sleep
indulgence in daydreams or unrealistic fantasies
examples: Scientists study brain patterns during dreaming
Dreaming occurs most frequently during REM sleep
Stop dreaming and focus on realistic goals
She spent hours dreaming about her future success

definitions: ideal or imaginary place of happiness and perfection
state of sleep or unconsciousness
examples: The tropical resort seemed like a dreamland to visitors
Children create their own dreamland through imagination
The baby finally drifted off to dreamland
Bedtime stories help children journey to dreamland

definitions: imaginary world created by dreams, fantasy, or unrealistic thinking
examples: She lived in a dreamworld disconnected from reality
The novel transported readers to a magical dreamworld

definitions: machine for removing mud and debris from water bottoms
container with perforated lid for sprinkling flour or sugar
examples: The harbor dredge cleared accumulated sediment from the channel
Mining dredges extract minerals from riverbeds
She used a dredge to dust the pastries with powdered sugar
The chef's dredge contained seasoned flour

definitions: art of training horses in precise movements and competitive equestrian sport
examples: Olympic dressage requires years of training and dedication
The horse and rider performed complex dressage movements

definitions: chest of drawers typically used for storing clothes
person who assists with costumes in theater or film
person who assists surgeons during medical procedures
examples: The antique dresser had six spacious drawers
She placed family photos on top of the bedroom dresser
The lead actor's dresser prepared costumes for quick changes
Broadway dressers work behind the scenes
The surgical dresser prepared sterile instruments
Hospital dressers maintain operating room standards

definitions: sterile covering applied to protect wounds or injuries
sauce for salads typically made with oil, vinegar, and seasonings
seasoned mixture used to stuff poultry or served as side dish
examples: The nurse changed the surgical dressing twice daily
Keep the dressing clean and dry to prevent infection
She made homemade ranch dressing for the salad
Italian dressing contains herbs, oil, and vinegar
Grandmother's turkey dressing recipe included sage and cornbread
They served dressing alongside the roasted chicken

definitions: person who makes custom clothing, especially women's dresses and garments
examples: The dressmaker created a custom wedding gown
Victorian dressmakers were essential for fashionable society

definitions: craft or business of making clothing, especially women's dresses
examples: She learned dressmaking from her grandmother
Dressmaking requires skill in pattern cutting and sewing

definitions: small flow or drops of liquid falling slowly
continuous bouncing or kicking of a ball while moving in sports
examples: A dribble of sauce ran down his chin
The faucet's constant dribble wasted water
His basketball dribble impressed the scouts
Soccer players practice their dribble techniques daily

definitions: act of liquid falling in drops or small amounts
skill of controlling a ball while moving in sports
examples: The dribbling of rain on the roof continued all night
Constant dribbling from the pipe indicated a leak
Professional dribbling requires excellent hand-eye coordination
His dribbling skills made him valuable to the team

definitions: machine that removes moisture from clothes, hair, or other items
substance added to paint or ink to speed drying
examples: The clothes drier stopped working during the cycle
She bought an energy-efficient hair drier
Artists add drier to oil paints for faster completion
The printer used a special drier in the ink

definitions: slow movement or deviation from a set course or position
mass of material deposited by wind, water, or glaciers
general underlying meaning or tendency of speech or writing
examples: The boat's drift took it far from the intended course
Continental drift shapes Earth's geography over millions of years
Snow drift blocked the mountain road completely
Sand drifts formed dunes in the desert
I understood the drift of her argument despite the complexity
The drift of public opinion shifted dramatically

definitions: person who moves from place to place without purpose or home
fishing vessel that uses drift nets
examples: The drifter worked odd jobs in different towns
Many drifters passed through the small railway station
The drifter returned to port with its catch
Commercial drifters use large nets

definitions: movement without fixed direction or purpose, carried by currents or circumstances
examples: The drifting of the clouds created changing patterns
Career drifting left him unsatisfied and restless

definitions: wood that has been washed ashore by water or wind action
examples: Artists create sculptures from weathered driftwood pieces
They collected driftwood to build a beach bonfire

definitions: tool with rotating cutting tip for making holes
repetitive training exercise or emergency procedure practice
durable cotton fabric with diagonal weave pattern
examples: The dentist used a small drill on the cavity
Power drills make home improvement projects easier
Fire drill procedures must be practiced monthly
Military drills instill discipline and coordination
The work pants were made from heavy drill fabric
Drill uniforms withstand rough conditions

definitions: action of making holes using a drill tool
process of exploring for oil, gas, or minerals underground
examples: The drilling created too much noise for the neighbors
Precision drilling requires steady hands and proper tools
Offshore drilling poses environmental risks
The company began drilling for natural gas

definitions: liquid suitable for swallowing to quench thirst or for pleasure
alcoholic beverage or the habit of consuming alcohol
examples: She ordered a cold drink from the cafe menu
Sports drinks help replace lost electrolytes
He struggled with drink for many years
They went out for drinks after work

definitions: person who drinks beverages, especially regularly
person who regularly consumes alcoholic beverages
examples: Coffee drinkers often start their day with espresso
Tea drinkers appreciate the variety of flavors available
Social drinkers limit alcohol to special occasions
Heavy drinkers risk developing health problems

definitions: act of swallowing liquids for hydration or pleasure
consumption of alcoholic beverages as a social activity or habit
examples: Drinking enough water is essential for good health
The doctor recommended drinking herbal tea
Underage drinking remains a serious social issue
Drinking establishments must follow licensing laws
